item.title: Book Review: War Commentaries of Caesar
item.description: I try to read one biography or autobiography a year and I just finished reading the War Commentaries of Caesar, translated by Rex Warner. This book is the autobiographical account of Roman proconsul and general Julius Caesar, who has left us a first person account in great detail of his various military campaigns. The book is divided into two parts: 1) The Gallic Wars (58-50 BC) and 2) The Civil Wars (49-48 BC).
